image.altText: Albanese Trump dinner

props.synopsis: As the US president promises South Korea can have nuclear submarines, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese insists this can be delivered alongside the AUKUS boats.

image.altText: Smiling older woman wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: An 80-year-old cruise ship passenger who was found dead on Lizard Island in Far North Queensland on the weekend has been identified as Sydney woman Suzanne Rees.

title.children: Family shocked after mum 'dies alone' on tropical island during cruise

image.altText: Barnaby Joyce at anti renewable energy protest

image.altText: A picture of a military-style boat

props.synopsis: Almost four weeks after a $25 million Australian-gifted patrol boat ran aground on a reef while ferrying government officials, the Vanuatu government has yet to reveal the circumstances around the grounding, saying "an investigation is continuing".Â

title.children: Questions over Australian-gifted patrol boat smashed on reef during 'VIP transport'

image.altText: A smiling teenager with cricket pictures in the background

props.synopsis: The cricket club where Ben Austin played says the teenager has died in hospital after being struck by a ball while practising in cricket nets earlier this week.

title.children: Cricket community encouraged to 'put their bats out' after death of teenager

image.altText: An armed soldier and hospital workers unload bodies at a hospital while a crowd looks on

props.synopsis: Brazil's deadliest ever police operation has triggered protests against the use of excessive force and calls for Rio's governor to resign.

title.children: Rio de Janeiro drug raid leaves at least 120 dead

image.altText: A woman in Senate chambers.

props.synopsis: In a week when Labor earned a poor scorecard for its transparency, the Coalition was wasting time responding to yet another self-inflicted saga.

image.altText: A boy holds his hands to his face as sits among the contents of a home that has apparently been destroyed.

props.synopsis: Despite more than 100 Palestinians being killed by Israel in little more than 12 hours, the ceasefire continues to hold, though that technicality does not mean much to those on the ground.

title.children: Israel's latest strikes highlight a difficult truth about the Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A composite image of signage of Australia's 'big four' banks ANZ, Westpac, the Commonwealth Bank and NAB signage

props.synopsis: A shock from the all-important consumer price index has left economists rewriting their rates outlooks, ahead of the Reserve Bank meeting next week.

title.children: Borrowers can expect one more rate cut, if they're lucky, bank economists predict

image.altText: A woman looks seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: The Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commission found systems meant to keep governments accountable are so fragmented they are leading to authorities passing the buck on responsibility.

title.children: National watchdog needed for violence against women, commissioner says

image.altText: Kamala Harris looks at Joe Biden as he speaks from a presidential lectern.

title.children: Joe Biden was exposed by his frailties. They're still exposing Kamala Harris

image.altText: crypto atm scam victim Dorothy Dyall, Oct 2025

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: The dam has been previously searched by divers, but draining it will allow a "comprehensive visual search" to be completed, police say.

image.altText: image of whale caracass with netting around its tail from aerial view

image.altText: Utes lined up blocking a track to the sea

image.altText: Three men sit with their heads bowed in chairs in front of three judges.

image.altText: A worker in high-vis stands next to the interior of a ship hull showing crossbeams of metal.

props.synopsis: The government can't hide its frustration with Rio Tinto, but at the same time it's preparing to dip deeper into taxpayers' pockets to help the company out. Again.

image.altText: Donald Trump and Lee Jae Myung smile while shaking hands near a massive gold crown

image.altText: The silhouette of a man at a laptop.

image.altText: Man in suit and sunglasses beside a woman in a suit jacket and pink shirt wearing sunglasses.

image.altText: A woman looks seriously down the barrel of a camera.

props.synopsis: A woman, who was unable to call triple-0 after men broke into her home while she was in her bedroom, is demanding answers from the telco as calls ramp up for a complete overhaul of the system.

image.altText: An arrangement of 20 different sunscren products on a background of pink bathroom tiles.

title.children: Sunscreen maker at centre of recalls blocked by US regulator for years

props.synopsis: With major changes to the aged care system looming this week, price hikes for older people accessing support at home could mean their aged care packages will not stretch as far.

image.altText: A sign that reads Microsoft in white letters on a glass building.

image.altText: Ryan stands in front of his organic and sleek modern passive house that's all concrete, big windows, with surprising boulders.

image.altText: Denise and Bruce Morcomb and David Crisafulli stand together smiling. Bruce is giving a thumbs up.

image.altText: A headshot of Drake, dressed in black on-stage.

props.synopsis: Superstar rapper Drake is appealing the dismissal of his defamation lawsuit against Universal Music Group over the Kendrick Lamar diss track Not Like Us.

image.altText: Australia celebrates wicket
